metadata.title: CVE-2014-8128 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
LibTIFF prior to 4.0.4, as used in Apple iOS before 8.4 and OS X before10.10.4 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted TIFF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

bug: http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2499 (thumbnail and tiffcmp) [not fixed yet in CVS HEAD]

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2').
